title: "New accounts are $11 idc if I get banned."
body:
What's the answer to this? Someone said this to me earlier today in game, and it's so unbelievably frustrating because I know it's true. I can report and feel good for 'doing my part for the community' but then it doesn't matter because anyone can get banned and jump right back into ranked the next day, for the same price as a movie ticket.

It just... makes me sad that these people can ruin games for others over and over again with literally no fear of real consequences.

replies.body: no bro you just made him spend 11$. good shit
Fuck yeah that's a whole week's allowance GG

11 bucks once is nothing. 11 bucks over time is a lot. He'll either learn sooner and pay little to nothing, or learn later and pay a lot or stop playing. 

On top of that, these boards frequently have people who say shit like that and come here crying they got banned. Report the assholes.
I love it when someone complains about how unfair their ban was, but in their chat log they claimed "lol go ahead and report idc"

I have 2 concerns. 
Who gets an $11 allowance?
And where is this movie theater that only costs $11 a ticket. I can't bring my girl to a movie for under $30 (before snacks)

"Who gets an $11 allowance?"
Young children. (Tags: explaining-the-joke)

I don't know where your $11 movie theatre would be found, but mine costs like eight dollars.
Most of the NE USA. 8-10 is typical. 10 years ago the theater in Fairbanks, Alaska had $1 movie mondays. That place was packed every Monday night. They also had air hockey and foos-ball tables.

Major name theaters, Regal, AMC, and some Cinemarks are no less than $13, and $15 Fri/Sat. In some neighborhoods, (those not in the city) the Cinemark might be $8-10, definitely $7.50 if you go before 3:00pm. Even with my student ID I can't get in for less than $10 anywhere.
Unless you are looking for one that serves champagne, most theaters standard ticket prices are around $12.50, give or take a dollar or two.

And ban an entire college campus? There's a reason they stopped doing IP bans.
That would suck, but im sure there is a way to work around that. Account bans are just worthless when you can make (or buy) a new account. IP  bans are the only effective bans in games.

And college campuses only have 1 external IP address, thus only one place where Riot can attempt an IP ban. 

The "work around" is to change how the entire internet works, so if you want to get on that so you can IP ban someone, be my guest.

Well I just have a house where I live in you know. Its not riot's fault that you decided to live in a place where IP's are shared. We dont have things like dorms here in europe so we dont have those kind of problems.

And I suppose it wouldn't be Riot's fault if you moved into a house where the previous owner had an IP Ban? Or if you moved into an apartment with internet provided, but had it networked together for the entire complex? Or if your roommate/sibling got banned? There are more situations than just colleges where the problem manifests itself.

I believe ISP's will also re-issue you an IP address if you ask for it, which makes IP Bans even more hassle and less practical.
lol, I think you can even force the server to issue you a new IP address if you know the procedures, but it's not an average know-how and doesn't work for shared ip addresses

I was about to say, you can get a new IP aswell. But its still more effort than just registering a new account with no problems. Getting banned on league now just encourages toxic players to go make a level 1 account and go troll level 1s which makes starting league as a new player even worse than it already is.

The answer for this is Riot needs to get a handle on botting in their game.

The reason these accounts are so plentiful and cheap is because people can run scripts to have accounts automatically level up in modes like 3v3 or Dominion.

This is pretty true. Had a game with bots in it the other day I and I thought that shit was solved a long time ago.

Back when botting exploded the solution seemed to be "nerf Refer a Friend" now RAF is gone completely and bots still exist.

Pretty sure I voiced concerns that botting wasn't _just_ happening because of RAF rewards back when that got addressed and it was so that people who were perma'd could just buy another account, looks like I was right, sadly.
:/ I know the feels.  Just stay as strong as possible and just remember you are always taking the high road and being the bigger person by ignoring and reporting them.

Yeah :/ My ranked experience is usually pretty good, but it's just so shitty when one guy decides that all 5 of you are going to lose LP, and no amount of mechanics or warding or teamwork can change that. A loss that you can't even learn from is the worst experience in this game.
